intro: Willoughbya heterophylla, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a unique flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that bloom during the summer months, typically from December to February. The plant has a distinctive morphology, with leaves that vary in shape depending on their position on the plant—ovate and glossy near the base, and linear and narrow towards the top. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and coastal environments. Willoughbya heterophylla is also notable for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in Indigenous Australian cultures.
